FacilityName: Smithfield Fresh Meats Corp. - Clinton, NC
ParentCompanyName: United Global Foods US Holdings Inc

_prev_prog_3.Description: As a vital element of the facilityA?s prevention program, Smithfield Clinton Plant has inaugurated a Process Safety Management Program as mandated by OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 (Process Safety Management).  Smithfield Clinton Plant has implemented strict preventive maintenance procedures and an Integrated Contingency Plan.  Release of ammonia is specially covered in the Emergency Plan and contains all required actions in the event of release of ammonia.  As part of the facility's accidental release prevention, training is conducted for employees and new hires.  Accidental release prevention, training and awareness are reinforced annually and as operations at the facility dictates.

_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: Sampson County Off of Emerg Mgt

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Smithfield is engaged in the production of pork products for human consumption.  The facility is located at 424 East Railroad Street, Clinton, NC 28328.  The NAICS code is 311612.  The facility has approximately 1850 full time employees and operates 24 hours/day, 7 days/week, 52 weeks/year.



This Plan informs all interested parties that this facility is participating in the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) program defined in 29 CFR 1910.119 and the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) defined in 40 CFR Part 68. These programs provide for the implementation of detailed Prevention and response procedures when storing and handling hazardous chemicals. The program objectives are to ensure worker and public safety and to provide environmental protection.

 

Anhydrous ammonia is the only substance at the facility that is regulated under the PSM and RMP programs. This is the same type of ammonia commonly sprayed on fields by farmers to fertilize crops. Anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant throughout the plant to maintain desired meat temperatures in coolers, freezers and working areas. Expelling heat caused from altering the ammonia between a liquid and a gas state creates refrigeration in the facility. This refrigeration system consists of a series of compressors, condensers, evaporators, vessels, piping and valves.

 

The offsite consequence of analysis was determined utilizing the online browser based RMP*Comp, and the population data is based upon information pulled from Marplot on 2/2/2018. How to determine the WCS & ARS was derived from the Supplemental Risk Management Program Guidance for Ammonia Refrigeration Facilities (May 2004).



The ammonia refrigeration system is operated with a variety of safety devices employed within the system, included are: high and low level automated shutdown systems and high and low pressure automated shutdown systems. Alarm systems are utilized to provide early detection of problems within the system

before shutdowns occur.



This facility's emergency response program is an action plan to respond to and resolve incidents associated with the ammonia refrigeration system. The Fire Department / Hazmat Team will be notified so that they can provide assistance during an incident. If it is necessary to contact the public regarding an Ammonia release, the local fire department will be contacted to coordinate with the police department. The police department will notify residents and business locations.



This facility has not had a reportable release in the past five years.



The facility utilizes Process Hazard Analysis, Compliance Audits, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews, Mechanical Integrity inspections, Preventative Maintenance activity, equipment inspections, and training to ensure mitigation and control of potential incidents.

 

The facility will make changes to the system and train as necessary to resolve items noted during the Process Hazard Analysis, Compliance Audit, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews, and Mechanical Integrity inspections to improve the safety of the system. Changes will be placed on an action list, evaluated, and implemented in a timely manner.
